gurmukhi: Agnq mwry gnY ko BjY ju sur kir qRws ]
transliteration: Agadat Mdare Gadai Ko Bhajai Ju Sur Kar(i0 Traas||
translation: Innumerable gods were killed and innumerable ran away in fear.

gurmukhi: Dwir iDAwn mn isvw ko qkI purI kYlws ]19]
transliteration: Ddaar(i) Dhiaan Man Sivaa Ko Taki Puroo Kailaas||19||
translation: All (the remaining) gods, meditating on Shiva, went towards Kailash mountain.19.

gurmukhi: dyvn ky Dn Dwm sB dYqn lIE iCnwie ]
transliteration: Devak Ke Dhan Dhaam Sabh Daitan Looo Chhinaae||
translation: The demons seized all the abodes and wealth of gods.

gurmukhi: dey kwF sur Dwm qy bsy isv purI jwie ]20]
transliteration: Dae Kaadh Sur Dhaam Te Bade Siv Puroo Jaae||20||
translation: They drove them out of the city of gods, the gods then came to live in the city of Shiva.20.

gurmukhi: ikqik idvs bIqy qhwN nwvn inksI dyv ]
transliteration: Kitak(i) Divas Boote Tahaan Naavan Niksoo Dev||
translation: After several days goddess came to take a bath there.

gurmukhi: ibD pUrb sB dyvqn krI dyv kI syv ]21]
transliteration: Bidh Poorab Sabh Devtan Daroo Dev Koo Sev||21||
translation: All the gods, according to the prescribed method, made obeisance to her.21.

gurmukhi: krI hY hkIkq mlUm Kud dyvI syqI lIAw mhKwsur hmwrw CIn Dwm hY ]
transliteration: Daroo Hai Hakookat Maloom Khud Devoo Setoo Looaa Mahkhaasur Hamaaraa Chhodhn Dhaam Hai||
translation: The gods told the goddess all their occurrences; sating that the demon-king Mahishaura had seized all their abodes.

gurmukhi: kIjY soeI bwq mwq qum kau suhwq sB syvk kdIm qk Awey qyrI swm hY ]
transliteration: Koojai Sooo Maat Toum Kau Suhaat Sabh Sevak Kadoom Tak Aae Teroo Saam Hai||
translation: They said, “O mother, Thou mayest do whatever pleasest Thee, we have all come to seek Thy refuge.

gurmukhi: dIjY bwj dys hmY mytIAY klys lys kIjIAY ABys aunY bfo Xh kwm hY ]
transliteration: Doojai Baaj Des Hamai Metooai Kales Les Koojooai Abhes Ounai Bado Yah Kaam Hai||
translation: “Please get us back our abodes, remove our suffering and make those demons garbles and wealthless. This is a very great task which can only be accomplished by Thee.

gurmukhi: kUkr ko mwrq n koaU nwm lY kY qwih mwrq hY qw ko lY kY KwvMd ko nwm hY ]22]
transliteration: Kookar Ko Maarat Na Ko( i)  Naam Lai Kai Taah(i) Maarat Hai Taa Ko Lai Kai Khaavand Ko Naam Hai||22||
translation: “No one beats or talks ill to the dog, only his master is rebuked and censured.”22.
